column5: We're cleaning the basement in preparing our house before we sell it. I came across some boxes that my mom packed up long-ago when I left home, and then have sat in my basement for 10 years.  I thought this might interest some here. There is no date on it, but it has been packed away for 20 years.

I've got three old tadpollys from my oldmans tackle box..  Green/yellow, red with black spots and a blue-ish chrome one..   We used to flatline those things in the spring for salmon/trout, they loved them.

Pretty neat.  I like finding things like that.  I have to say though, there is nothing more Canadian than an 8" section of an old hockey stick with two hooks attached!  At least that's what that "Grant Bait" looks like, lol.  I bet it worked great too.

It still does work... great..!  Gentlemen: We, the undersigned hereby petition your honorable body and the Honorable Governor of the State of Wisconsin, to hereby issue an order to prohibit Frank Suick of the city of Antigo, County of Langlade, State of Wisconsin from fishing or taking of fish in Pelican Lake, located in Oneida County, until such time whereby other fisherman are able to catch fish out of the above mentioned lake. We hereby do this in the interest of Muskies at large."
My favorite salmon bait bottom left handsdown
I remember those mats too !!!! They used to give them out at the sportsman shows and places like that !!!!!! Kinda cool !!!!!!!
I have several of those in my daily tackle box.
